sheet.name: en
sheet.text: Chase down SQUID to defeat it! Sonic can avoid the bullets by moving to the left or right.
Hold down while moving, to boost in the direction the character is facing. Boosting consumes the boost meter.
Quick Cyloop can be activated pressing during a combo while the Cyloop meter is blue. The meter fills up with every attack that hits an enemy.
Parrying is not contingent on timing (but it should be). Hold + to Parry, and attacks will be automatically repelled.
When holding down while moving, Sonic will boost in the direction he is running towards. Boosting consumes the boost meter.
Press when the target cursor is displayed to perform a Homing Attack.
Holding while moving will leave a light trail. If the light trail is enclosed, releasing may cause various effects to happen.
rotates the camera. The camera cannot be operated when the camera disabled icon is displayed.
If something seems suspicious, use a Cyloop. Hidden items or a means to complete a Challenge may be discovered.
Quick Cyloop can be activated by pressing during a combo while the Cyloop meter is blue. The meter fills up with every attack that hits an enemy.
Press while the target cursor is displayed to lock on. While locked on, the camera will automatically track the target.
Parrying is not contingent on timing (but it should be). Hold + to Parry, and Sonic will automatically repel attacks.
Press or to Dodge. Dodging is quicker than normal movement and is useful for avoiding enemy attacks.
When the combo meter is maxed out, Phantom Rush will be activated, and basic attacks will be 1.5 times more powerful. This lasts until the combo meter runs down to 0.
During battle, it is possible to dodge into Wild Rush by pressing or then .
During battle, Air Boost can lead to a Homing Shot by pressing then in the air.
During a combo, Stomp Attack can be triggered with .
Hold in the air or during a combo to activate Sonic Boom.
During a combo, press to activate Spin Slash.
During battle, activate Loop Kick after Air Boost by pressing then in the air.
During battle, activate Cross Slash after Air Boost by pressing then in the air.
Hold during a combo to launch a Cyclone Kick.
Press + when the prompt appears on the screen to launch Grand Slam.
If Sonic is thrown back by an attack, press before he hits the ground. Sonic will immediately counterattack with a Recovery Smash attack.
Press to jump. Jumping is useful for going over obstacles or preventing falls.
Press in the air to Double Jump. Use Double Jump to adjust Sonic's jump direction.
Press when the target cursor is displayed to perform a Homing Attack.
When holding down while moving, Sonic will boost in the direction he is running towards. Boosting consumes the boost meter.
Press in the air to Stomp. This is useful for a quick descent.
If you press and hold Sonic will do a series of stomps. The third stomp is the most powerful and deals damage in a wide burst.
Press in the air to perform an Air Boost. This is useful to reach areas that can't be reached just by jumping.
Press or while moving, to quickly step to the left or right. Use this to have Sonic avoid obstacles while running.
Press near a line of Rings. Sonic will zoom through them.
After a Double Jump, press and hold again until landing to move faster for a short period of time.
Press to Slide. This is useful to destroy obstacles or slow down Sonic.
Sonic can run on some walls while climbing by holding .
While using Air Boost toward a wall that is climbable, hold to move faster on the wall.
Sonic will automatically grind on rails. He can leave the rail by jumping off it.
Homing Attacks are not possible when on the grind rail.
When grind rails are parallel to each other, change rails by moving in the direction of the rail to transfer to.
When Sonic is surrounded with sparks while in the air, use to perform an Air Trick. When an Air Trick is successful, Skill Pieces are earned.
tip035
GIGANTO can repel Quick Cyloops. Try one and Sonic'll be sent flying.
WYVERN's missiles can be parried. Successfully hit one back to slow down WYVERN.
Use Quick Cyloop to restrain WYVERN.
Feeling underpowered against the enemies? Try leveling up Sonic's stats at the Elder Koco and Hermit Koco. Prefer to focus on the story? Change the game difficulty by going into Options.
Evade enemy attacks by jumping or dodging. While the target cursor is displayed, Sonic can attack with Homing Attacks and combos.
Shielded enemies can be broken through via Cyloop.
When the enemy's guard is up, use or to get behind them.
Use Cyloop to remove enemy spikes.
Repel enemies that jump into Sonic's path with Parry.
Use Parry to bounce back the enemy's beam attack. If Sonic can get on top of the enemy, use Stomp.
When Sonic approaches, this enemy curls up to protect itself. Use Cyloop to defeat it.
Sometimes these enemies speed up their rotations. Carefully time when to attack!
Cyloop can take this enemy down with a single blow. Wait for when it pauses after it rushes at Sonic.
If the enemy comes at Sonic while spinning sideways, use Parry to defeat it.
Try to attack the enemy between the electric discharges.
The armor covering the enemy's body is tough, but Cyloop can temporarily render it defenseless.
Use Homing Attack to get up close to enemies in the sky. Careful not to hit the red balls!
If Sonic gets trapped inside, use Jump Stomp to break through.
If Sonic is launched into the air, use Stomp to recover.
The enemy that steals the Chaos Emerald is the same one that needs to be defeated to get it back. Stomp it out and get it back!
Each attack can be parried. If Sonic is about to be attacked, hold + to parry it.
Occasionally, they will attack from an unexpected location, so use Parry to repel them.
When MASTER NINJA guards, blow it away with a Cyloop!
Destroy the enemy's body and attack its weak point: the head. Cyloop can destroy part of the body with a single blow.
Cyloop is effective on SPIDER's legs. When diving, aim for the ring of lasers and drop down!
Get the items on the rail to get free from the grind rails!
When CATERPILLAR goes on the run, be careful of bullets it unleashes!
Chase down SQUID to defeat it! Sonic can avoid the bullets by moving to the left or right.
When SQUID raises its barrier, surround it with a Cyloop to break it.
If SQUID swings its arm, try Dodging or Parrying to bounce back!
Surround the pedestal connected to GHOST to take them down before Sonic runs out of Rings!
Get to the top of ASURA via the arms and body. When Sonic touches the blue circle of light, he can run up faster.
When Sonic holds the tail, the enemy will act wildly, but by tilting as it moves, Sonic will be able to keep his balance.
If Sonic is pulled in while the burners are out, use Homing Attack to avoid bumping into it.
Use the ropes to push SUMO to the charged area. The more bounces Sonic gets, the more force in his push.
Slide all the way around the big circles to reveal the enemy's weak points!
After threatening Sonic with a bomb, the FORTRESS will flee.
When KNIGHT's shield is up, Sonic can circle around to land direct hits.
Taking a hit from a Titan's attack eats up precious time. Watch for signs of an attack and aim to dodge or parry!
Use Quick Cyloop to summon spears that will hold down KNIGHT and create an opening.
When battling the Titan, sometimes it will counterattack. Parry this attack to create more opportunities for Sonic.
There are certain surfaces on GIGANTO that allow Sonic to speed up. Use these to quickly climb up.
If Sonic uses Parry insetad of Dodging against GIGANTO's attacks, he can unleash a powerful counterattack.
Using a boosted dash is the fastest way to reach WYVERN.
Parry WYVERN attacks to create opportunities to counter attack.
Avoid the spikes and get to KNIGHT's head!
Ride on KNIGHT's shield to take control of it and deal a blow to KNIGHT.
Parry the shield back towards KNIGHT and create an opening to attack.
Destroy the floating turrets, Bits, to get a chance to strike back at GIGANTO 2.
Parry GIGANTO 2's laser to destroy the floating turrets, the Bits.
GIGANTO 2 can repel Quick Cyloops. Try one and Sonic'll be sent flying.
Use to move up, down, left or right. Remember the hacking tips and good luck!
THE END's beam cannot be negated with a shot. Watch its movements and dodge carefully.
Koco will run away from Sonic. Carefully consider an approach to successfully lead them to the goal!
Mow lots grass at once to earn more points. Try to enclose as much area as possible in one Cyloop.
When a Koco's bomb explodes, it whips up a sandstorm. In the sandstorm, use the Koco sound to find them.
If the TOWER is going too fast for Sonic to pass under it, try to carry only a few Koco at a time!
Find a way to attack the TOWER's weak point directly on the head.
Be careful not to let the containers or Sonic fall into the lava! Some footholds will collapse if Sonic steps on them.
Use the Springs and Rainbow Rings to reach the goal within the time limit!
Move to the left or right to control the commander program. Try not to get hit by enemy bullets.
When the special gauge is full, the homing laser can be fired with . In a pinch, it can be used to eliminate enemy bullets!
As long as the target core is defeated, the game will be cleared even if there are normal enemies still left.
Unsure how to proceed? Look at the objective in the upper right corner of the screen, or head in the direction of the ◇ symbol.
In order to talk to Amy or the others, Sonic must stabilize their frequency. Explore the islands and collect Memory Tokens to do so.
Open the Chaos Emerald Vault with a Vault Key obtained by completing Portal missions.
Portals are usually locked. Unlock them by defeating guardians and using the Portal Gears they drop.
Use the map as a guide for traveling. Press to open the map.
Maps can be used in many ways. To set a specific destination, set a map marker.
After completing all Challenges on an island, Sonic will be able to fast travel to any Portal on the island.
In addition to the normal Portals with missions, "Purple Portals" lead to fishing spots. Collect Purple Coins on the island and go fishing.
In addition to Seeds, fishing yields items useful for progression, such as Memory Tokens, Portal Gears, and Vault Keys.
Fishing will sometimes yield "scrolls." These scrolls allow fast travel to the Elder Koco and Hermit Koco.
Elder Koco is a round, large Koco. If lost Koco are returned to him, he will raise Sonic's Ring capacity or speed level in return.
Hermit Koco is a large, tall Koco. He can increase Sonic's attack and defense with the seeds obtained on the island and also can redistribute the upgrades given by the Elder Koco.
Completing Challenges on the island will reveal part of the map. Try to unlock as much of the map as possible.
When exploring and completing Challenges around the island, Sonic can get Red Seeds of Power and Blue Seeds of Defense. Visit Hermit Koco to use them to improve Sonic's stats.
After completing two Challenges that are near each other, an Ancients' rail will be drawn between them. This is useful for speedier travel.
When is displayed in the upper right corner of the screen for tutorials, Challenges, or Island Mysteries, the details will be shown.
As Sonic roams around the island, there will be times when he meets other characters. Talk with them and hear their stories.
When an enemy is defeated, they can drop blue-colored Skill Pieces. Collecting enough will give Skill Points, shown in the lower right corner. These can be used to unlock Skills from the Pause Menu.
Press to open the Pause Menu. This grants access to Skills and various settings.
Some objects placed on the island are destructible and can contain items.
On nights with a starfall, defeated enemies will be resurrected. Destroyed objects will also be repaired and items can be obtained from them again.
While exploring the island, an action notification may appear. Press to practice the actions.
Sonic cannot enter Portals or talk to NPCs during battle. Defeat the enemies around him first.
Koco lurk in various places on the island. Find them and take them to Elder Koco!
When running low on Rings, use Cyloop on the surrounding grass, sand, or other ground to make Rings appear.
Sonic is able to climb up black walls. He can also run up them while is pressed.
When there is a Chaos Emerald Vault or Portal nearby, icons will appear at the top center of the screen.
If Sonic boosts by pressing with the maximum number of Rings, his speed will greatly increase.
Some objects on the island can be used as shortcuts if activated.
Give Hermit Koco red fruit to raise Sonic's attack power, and blue fruit to raise Sonic's defense power.
Find and bring Koco to the Elder Koco. He will be able to raise Sonic's top speed and max Ring capacity. Elder Koco can also reset the upgrades.
Sonic's outfit can be changed by going to Title Screen > Extras > Sonic Outfits
Access the Photo Mode from the Pause menu. Freely change the camera placement and angle as Sonic explores the islands!
When the Juke Box is enabled, the island BGM can be changed. Head to Options to turn the Juke Box ON/OFF.
Find Sound Memories on the islands to unlock more songs for the Juke Box.
To turn off the Slot Machine, head to Options > Game Settings > Starfall Slot Machine > set to OFF.
To turn off the Power Boost Scene, head to Options > Game Settings > Power Boost Scene > set to OFF.
Cyber Space Challenge is a time attack mode in which a succession of Cyber Space Stages are played in a row. This mode can be accessed from the Title Screen.
Head to Options > Game settings > set Cyber Space Power Boost ON to use the Power Boost in Cyber Space.
Battle Rush is a timed battle mode in which enemies, guardians, and Titans can be fought. This mode can be accessed from the Title Screen.
Extreme difficulty can only be chosen when starting a new game. At this level, Sonic's stats will no longer increase and the enemies will be substantially stronger.
Holding on the ground and pressing will cause Sonic to spin. Release to unleash the Spin Dash. Using Spin Dash will use the boost gauge.
When in the air with no enemies nearby, hold and land to activate a Spin Dash. Using Spin Dash will use the boost gauge.
In Cyber Space, Cyber Space Challenge, Battle Rush, and Action Chain Challenge, press ＋＋ to restart the Stage.
When the Juke Box is ON, press to change the song. Hold it to open the song list.
Using Cyloop in a given location will start the Action Chain Challenge. The higher the score multiplier, the faster the chain gauge will decrease. Chain the actions well and get a high score!
Head to the Map > Switch Maps to see the island completion rates.
Head to the Title Screen > Extras to change friends' outfits and the island appearance.
If you select "New Game+" on the Title Screen and load your game clear data, Sonic's skills and stats will carry over.
Parrying normally will not work on THE END.
Perfect Parry will create an opening for attacks.
Find something else to do besides attacking THE END.
THE END replenishes its energy from the fake moon. Is there a way to sever the connection?
Perfect Parry is effective against THE END. Use it against various attacks.
THE END can't be defeated through dealing damage alone. Find something else to attack.
THE END will sometimes target the Cyber Shield around Sonic's friends. Block the attack and protect the Cyber Shield.
Learn new Skills and continue on.
Learn new Skills and continue on.
Learn new Skills and continue on.
Gather Lookout Koco and unseal a Trial Tower.
Learn new Skills and continue on.
Learn new Skills and continue on.
Learn new Skills and continue on.
Gather Lookout Koco and unseal a Trial Tower.
Fight with everything learned so far.
Each character brings unique ways to tackle challenges. If a task is difficult, try swapping characters.
Press to jump. Jumping is useful for going over obstacles and preventing falls.
Press when the target cursor is displayed to perform a Homing Attack.
Hold down while moving, to boost in the direction the character is facing. Boosting consumes the boost meter.
Press in midair to double jump. Double jumping allows the character to change direction and adjust their landing.
Press after a Double Jump to activate Card Float. Hold to gently return to the ground.
Use ＋ with MAX Rings to Card Spin Boost. While it's active, drift with ＋.
Press with no target cursors to activate a Card Attack.
After a Card Attack, use to activate Card Spin. Holding it will make Amy spin for longer, but she will get dizzy.
Hold to aim at multiple targets. Release after multiple target cursors appear to hit them all. Depending on the targets, they can all be taken out with one hit.
Press in midair to activate Card Stomp and deal damage to enemies with the blow.
After a Card Stomp, hold to do a High Card Jump.
When the meter is full, activate Cyhammer with . Gather Rings and items to refill the meter. Use this near special signs to make objects and items appear.
Activate Card Spin with MAX Rings to spin faster, and Amy won't get dizzy.
Holding on the ground and pressing will cause Amy to spin. Release to unleash the Spin Dash. Using Spin Dash will use the boost gauge.
Parrying is not contingent on timing (but it should be). Hold + to Parry, and attacks will be automatically repelled.
Enemies who are parried will have reduced health for a short while.
Hold after a Double Jump to glide. Knuckles can't glide forever and will gradually lose altitude. Use to change direction.
Knuckles can climb not only green walls, but also red walls. Use to climb faster.
Activate Drill Spin Boost with ＋ with MAX Rings. Coming into contact with enemies will damage them during this move.
Press with no target cursors to unleash a maximum 3-hit combo.
Hold to aim at multiple targets. Release after multiple target cursors appear to enter a drill spin state and hit them all.
Press in midair to activate Heat Stomp. The resulting shockwave will damage enemies.
When the meter is full, activate Cyknuckle with . Gather Rings and items to refill the meter. Use this near special signs to make objects and items appear.
Glide with MAX Rings and Knuckles will glide faster and hold altitude for longer.
Holding on the ground and pressing will cause Knuckles to spin. Release to unleash the Spin Dash. Using Spin Dash will use the boost gauge.
Parrying is not contingent on timing (but it should be). Hold + to Parry, and attacks will be automatically repelled.
Enemies who are parried will have reduced defense for a short while.
Hold after a Double Jump to fly up and then parallel to the ground. Use to move while in the air. Tails can't fly forever and will eventually get tired and lose altitude.
Press ＋ with MAX Rings to use Cyclone Boost. It can be activated in midair as well. Use to steer.
Press on land or in the air to throw wrenches forward.
Hold to use the Charged Wrench Attack. The wrenches will fly at target cursors and deal multiple hits to enemies.
Press in midair to transform the blaster into a pile bunker and launch a diving attack.
When the meter is full, fire the Cyblaster with . Gather Rings and items to refill the meter. Use this near special signs to make objects and items appear.
Fire a beam from the Cyclone with ＋ with MAX Rings. Aim the beam with .
Holding on the ground and pressing will cause Tails to spin. Release to unleash the Spin Dash. Using Spin Dash will use the boost gauge.
Parrying is not contingent on timing (but it should be). Hold + to Parry, and attacks will be automatically repelled.
Enemies who are parried will have reduced attack power for a short while.
Talk to Map Koco with colors that match the character to unlock a portion of the map.
Talk to Skill Piece Koco with colors that match the character to gain Skill Pieces. Use them to unlock Skills and further explore the island.
Clear a Master Koco trial once, to be able to retake it again.
Cyloop around the spike bombs on the ground to launch them at its armor.
Dodge and jump to avoid the various shots and get closer.
Use Cyloop on the pedestal connected to GHOST to damage it. Take it down before it steals all the Rings.
Hold to aim at multiple targets. Release after multiple target cursors appear to hit them all. Depending on the targets, they can all be taken out with one hit.
When the special gauge is full, the homing laser can be fired with . In a pinch, it can be used to eliminate enemy bullets!
Holding while moving will leave a light trail. If the light trail is enclosed, releasing , may cause various effects to happen.
After a Card Attack, use to activate Card Spin. Holding it will make Amy spin for longer, but she will get dizzy.
Move to the left or right to control the commander program. Try not to get hit by enemy bullets.
Press with no target cursors to activate a Card Attack.
When the enemy's guard is up, use or to get behind them.
Press and hold near a line of Rings. Sonic will zoom through them.
Fire a beam from the Cyclone with ＋ with MAX Rings. Aim the beam with .
Press or while moving, to quickly step to the left or right. Use this to have Sonic avoid obstacles while running.
When the meter is full, fire the Cyblaster with . Gather Rings and items to refill the meter. Use this near special signs to make objects and items appear.
During battle, Air Boost can lead to Homing Shot by pressing then in the air.
Press + when the prompt appears on the screen to launch Grand Slam.
During battle, it is possible to dodge into Wild Rush by pressing or then .
Hold to use the Charged Wrench Attack. The wrenches will fly at target cursors and deal multiple hits to enemies.
Hold during a combo to launch a Cyclone Kick.
When the meter is full, activate Cyknuckle with . Gather Rings and items to refill the meter. Use this near special signs to make objects and items appear.
Parrying is not contingent on timing (but it should be). Hold + to Parry, and attacks will be automatically repelled.

In Cyber Space, Cyber Space Challenge, Battle Rush, and Action Chain Challenge, press ＋＋ to restart the Stage. If the key configuration has been changed, the command to restart the Stage will also change.
Press on land or in the air to throw wrenches forward.
Press or to Dodge. Dodging is quicker than normal movement and is useful for avoiding enemy attacks.
Hold to aim at multiple targets. Release after multiple target cursors appear to enter a drill spin state and hit them all.
Parrying is not contingent on timing (but it should be). Hold + to stay in Parry, and Sonic will automatically repel attacks.
Press when the target cursor is displayed to perform a Homing Attack.
Press with no target cursors to unleash a maximum 3-hit combo.
Parrying is not contingent on timing (but it should be). Hold + to Parry, and attacks will be automatically repelled.
Press while the target cursor is displayed to lock on. While locked on, the camera will automatically track the target.
Each attack can be parried. If Sonic is about to be attacked, hold + to parry it.
When the meter is full, activate Cyhammer with . Gather Rings and items to refill the meter. Use this near special signs to make objects and items appear.
